macro.name: LIBVIR_CHECK_VERSION
macro.info: Macro for developers to easily check what version of the library their code is compiling against. e.g. #if LIBVIR_CHECK_VERSION(1,1,3) // some code that only works in 1.1.3 and newer #endif

arg.name: major
arg.info: major component of the version number

arg.name: minor
arg.info: minor component of the version number

arg.name: micro
arg.info: micro component of the version number

macro.name: LIBVIR_VERSION_NUMBER
macro.info: Macro providing the version of the library as version * 1,000,000 + minor * 1000 + micro

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_GROUP_NAME
macro.info: The operating system group name as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_PROCESS_ID
macro.info: The operating system process ID as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_LLONG.

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_PROCESS_TIME
macro.info: The operating system process start time as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. The units the time is measured in vary according to the host operating system. On Linux this is usually clock ticks (as reported in /proc/$PID/stat field 22).

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_SASL_USER_NAME
macro.info: The SASL authenticated username as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_SELINUX_CONTEXT
macro.info: The application's SELinux context as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_UNIX_GROUP_ID
macro.info: The UNIX group ID as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_UNIX_USER_ID
macro.info: The UNIX user ID as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_USER_NAME
macro.info: The operating system user name as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_CONNECT_IDENTITY_X509_DISTINGUISHED_NAME
macro.info: The TLS x509 certificate distinguished named as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING

macro.name: VIR_COPY_CPUMAP
macro.info: This macro is to be used in conjunction with virDomainGetVcpus() and virDomainPinVcpu() APIs. VIR_COPY_CPUMAP macro extracts the cpumap of the specified vcpu from cpumaps array and copies it into cpumap to be used later by virDomainPinVcpu() API.

arg.name: cpumaps
arg.info: pointer to an array of cpumap (in 8-bit bytes) (IN)

arg.name: maplen
arg.info: the length (in bytes) of one cpumap

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a cpumap (in 8-bit bytes) (OUT) This cpumap must be previously allocated by the caller (ie: malloc(maplen))

macro.name: VIR_CPU_MAPLEN
macro.info: This macro is to be used in conjunction with virDomainPinVcpu() API. It returns the length (in bytes) required to store the complete CPU map between a single virtual & all physical CPUs of a domain.

macro.name: VIR_CPU_USABLE
macro.info: This macro is to be used in conjunction with virDomainGetVcpus() API. VIR_CPU_USABLE macro returns a non-zero value (true) if the cpu is usable by the vcpu, and 0 otherwise.

arg.name: cpumaps
arg.info: pointer to an array of cpumap (in 8-bit bytes) (IN)

arg.name: maplen
arg.info: the length (in bytes) of one cpumap

macro.name: VIR_CPU_USED
macro.info: This macro can be used in conjunction with virNodeGetCPUMap() API. It returns non-zero if the bit of the related CPU is set.

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN)

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_IN_AVERAGE
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound average of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_IN_BURST
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound burst of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_IN_FLOOR
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound floor of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_IN_PEAK
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound peak of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_OUT_AVERAGE
macro.info: Macro represents the outbound average of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_OUT_BURST
macro.info: Macro represents the outbound burst of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BANDWIDTH_OUT_PEAK
macro.info: Macro represents the outbound peak of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_DEVICE_READ_BPS
macro.info: Macro for the blkio tunable throttle.read_iops_device: it represents the bytes of reading the block device per second, as a string. The string is parsed as a series of /path/to/device, read_bps elements, separated by ','.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_DEVICE_READ_IOPS
macro.info: Macro for the blkio tunable throttle.read_iops_device: it represents the number of reading the block device per second, as a string. The string is parsed as a series of /path/to/device, read_iops elements, separated by ','.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_DEVICE_WEIGHT
macro.info: Macro for the blkio tunable weight_device: it represents the per-device weight, as a string. The string is parsed as a series of /path/to/device,weight elements, separated by ','.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_DEVICE_WRITE_BPS
macro.info: Macro for the blkio tunable throttle.read_iops_device: it represents the number of reading the block device per second, as a string. The string is parsed as a series of /path/to/device, write_bps elements, separated by ','.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_DEVICE_WRITE_IOPS
macro.info: Macro for the blkio tunable throttle.write_iops_device: it represents the number of writing the block device per second, as a string. The string is parsed as a series of /path/to/device, write_iops elements, separated by ','.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of virBlkioParameter. Provided for backwards compatibility; VIR_TYPED_PARAM_FIELD_LENGTH is the preferred value since 0.9.2.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLKIO_WEIGHT
macro.info: Macro for the Blkio tunable weight: it represents the io weight the guest can use, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COPY_BANDWIDTH
macro.info: Macro for the virDomainBlockCopy bandwidth tunable: it represents the maximum bandwidth in bytes/s, and is used while getting the copy operation into the mirrored phase, with a type of ullong. For compatibility with virDomainBlockJobSetSpeed(), values larger than 2^52 bytes/sec (a 32-bit MiB/s value) may be rejected on input due to overflow considerations (but do you really have an interface with that much bandwidth?), and values larger than 2^31 bytes/sec may cause overflow problems if queried in bytes/sec. Hypervisors may further restrict the set of valid values. Specifying 0 is the same as omitting this parameter, to request no bandwidth limiting. Some hypervisors may lack support for this parameter, while still allowing a subsequent change of bandwidth via virDomainBlockJobSetSpeed(). The actual speed can be determined with virDomainGetBlockJobInfo().

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COPY_BUF_SIZE
macro.info: Macro for the virDomainBlockCopy buffer size tunable: it represents how much data in bytes can be in flight between source and destination, as an unsigned long long. Specifying 0 is the same as omitting this parameter, to request the hypervisor default.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COPY_GRANULARITY
macro.info: Macro for the virDomainBlockCopy granularity tunable: it represents the granularity in bytes at which the copy operation recognizes dirty blocks that need copying, as an unsigned int. Hypervisors may restrict this to be a power of two or fall within a certain range. Specifying 0 is the same as omitting this parameter, to request the hypervisor default.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_GROUP_NAME
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents a group name to allow sharing of I/O throttling quota between multiple drives, as a string.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_READ_BYTES_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the read bytes per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_READ_BYTES_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the maximum read bytes per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_READ_BYTES_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the duration in seconds for the burst allowed by read_bytes_sec_max, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_READ_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the read I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_READ_IOPS_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the maximum read I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_READ_IOPS_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the duration in seconds for the burst allowed by read_iops_sec_max, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_SIZE_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the size I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_TOTAL_BYTES_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the total bytes per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_TOTAL_BYTES_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the maximum total bytes per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_TOTAL_BYTES_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the duration in seconds for the burst allowed by total_bytes_sec_max, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_TOTAL_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the total I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_TOTAL_IOPS_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the maximum I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_TOTAL_IOPS_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the duration in seconds for the burst allowed by total_iops_sec_max, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_WRITE_BYTES_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the write bytes per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_WRITE_BYTES_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the maximum write bytes per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_WRITE_BYTES_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the duration in seconds for the burst allowed by write_bytes_sec_max, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_WRITE_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the write I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_WRITE_IOPS_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the maximum write I/O operations per second permitted through a block device, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_IOTUNE_WRITE_IOPS_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro for the BlockIoTune tunable weight: it represents the duration in seconds for the burst allowed by write_iops_sec_max, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_ERRS
macro.info: In Xen this returns the mysterious 'oo_req', as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of parameter names when using virDomainBlockStatsFlags().

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_FLUSH_REQ
macro.info: Macro represents the total flush requests of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_FLUSH_TOTAL_TIMES
macro.info: Macro represents the total time spend on cache flushing in nano-seconds of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_READ_BYTES
macro.info: Macro represents the total number of read bytes of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_READ_REQ
macro.info: Macro represents the total read requests of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_READ_TOTAL_TIMES
macro.info: Macro represents the total time spend on cache reads in nano-seconds of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_WRITE_BYTES
macro.info: Macro represents the total number of write bytes of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_WRITE_REQ
macro.info: Macro represents the total write requests of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_STATS_WRITE_TOTAL_TIMES
macro.info: Macro represents the total time spend on cache writes in nano-seconds of the block device, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CPU_STATS_CPUTIME
macro.info: cpu usage (sum of both vcpu and hypervisor usage) in nanoseconds, as a ullong

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CPU_STATS_SYSTEMTIME
macro.info: cpu time charged to system instructions in nanoseconds, as a ullong

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CPU_STATS_USERTIME
macro.info: cpu time charged to user instructions in nanoseconds, as a ullong

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CPU_STATS_VCPUTIME
macro.info: vcpu usage in nanoseconds (cpu_time excluding hypervisor time), as a ullong

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_CALLBACK
macro.info: Used to cast the event specific callback into the generic one for use for virConnectDomainEventRegisterAny()

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_IOTHREAD_POLL_GROW
macro.info: This provides a value for the dynamic polling adjustment algorithm to use to grow its polling interval up to the poll_max_ns value. A value of 0 (zero) allows the hypervisor to choose its own value. The algorithm to use for adjustment is hypervisor specific.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_IOTHREAD_POLL_MAX_NS
macro.info: The maximum polling time that can be used by polling algorithm in ns. The polling time starts at 0 (zero) and is the time spent by the guest to process IOThread data before returning the CPU to the host. The polling time will be dynamically modified over time based on the poll_grow and poll_shrink parameters provided. A value set too large will cause more CPU time to be allocated the guest. A value set too small will not provide enough cycles for the guest to process data. The polling interval is not available for statistical purposes.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_IOTHREAD_POLL_SHRINK
macro.info: This provides a value for the dynamic polling adjustment algorithm to use to shrink its polling interval when the polling interval exceeds the poll_max_ns value. A value of 0 (zero) allows the hypervisor to choose its own value. The algorithm to use for adjustment is hypervisor specific.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_AUTO_CONVERGE_THROTTLE
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: current percentage guest CPUs are throttled to when auto-convergence decided migration was not converging, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPRESSION_BYTES
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of compressed bytes transferred since the beginning of migration, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPRESSION_CACHE
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: size of the cache (in bytes) used for compressing repeatedly transferred memory pages during live migration, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPRESSION_CACHE_MISSES
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of repeatedly changing pages that were not found in compression cache and thus could not be compressed, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPRESSION_OVERFLOW
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of repeatedly changing pages that were found in compression cache but were sent uncompressed because the result of compression was larger than the original page as a whole, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPRESSION_PAGES
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of compressed pages transferred since the beginning of migration, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_PROCESSED
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of bytes transferred from the beginning of the job, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to dataProcessed field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_REMAINING
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of bytes that still need to be transferred, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to dataRemaining field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_TOTAL
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: total number of bytes supposed to be transferred, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. For VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_UNBOUNDED jobs, this may be less than the sum of VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_PROCESSED and VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_REMAINING in the event that the hypervisor has to repeat some data, e.g., due to dirtied pages during migration. For VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_BOUNDED jobs, VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_TOTAL shall always equal VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_PROCESSED + VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_REMAINING. This field corresponds to dataTotal field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DISK_BPS
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: network throughput used while migrating disks in Bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DISK_PROCESSED
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_PROCESSED but only tracking guest disk progress, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to fileProcessed field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DISK_REMAINING
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_REMAINING but only tracking guest disk progress, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to fileRemaining field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DISK_TEMP_TOTAL
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: possible total temporary disk space for the job in bytes as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DISK_TEMP_USED
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: current usage of temporary disk space for the job in bytes as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DISK_TOTAL
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_TOTAL but only tracking guest disk progress, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to fileTotal field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DOWNTIME
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: downtime (ms) that is expected to happen during migration, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. The real computed downtime between the time guest CPUs were paused and the time they were resumed is reported for completed migration.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DOWNTIME_NET
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: real measured downtime (ms) NOT including the time required to transfer control flow from the source host to the destination host, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_BPS
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: network throughput used while migrating memory in Bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_CONSTANT
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of pages filled with a constant byte (all bytes in a single page are identical) transferred since the beginning of the migration job, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. The most common example of such pages are zero pages, i.e., pages filled with zero bytes.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_DIRTY_RATE
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of memory pages dirtied by the guest per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This statistics makes sense only when live migration is running.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_ITERATION
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: current iteration over domain's memory during live migration, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This is set to zero when memory starts to be transferred and the value is increased by one every time a new iteration is started to transfer memory pages dirtied since the last iteration.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_NORMAL
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of pages that were transferred without any kind of compression (i.e., pages which were not filled with a constant byte and which could not be compressed) transferred since the beginning of the migration job, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_NORMAL_BYTES
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number of bytes transferred as normal pages, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. See VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_NORMAL for more details.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: memory page size in bytes, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. If present, this parameter can be used to convert other page based statistics, such as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_DIRTY_RATE or VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPRESSION_PAGES to bytes.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_POSTCOPY_REQS
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: number page requests received from the destination host during post-copy migration, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This counter is incremented whenever the migrated domain tries to access a memory page which has not been transferred from the source host yet.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_PROCESSED
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_PROCESSED but only tracking guest memory progress, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to memProcessed field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_REMAINING
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_REMAINING but only tracking guest memory progress, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to memRemaining field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_MEMORY_TOTAL
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: as VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_DATA_TOTAL but only tracking guest memory progress, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to memTotal field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_OPERATION
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: the operation which started the job as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT. The values correspond to the items in virDomainJobOperation enum.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_SETUP_TIME
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: total time in milliseconds spent preparing the migration in the 'setup' phase before the iterations begin, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_SUCCESS
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: Present only in statistics for a completed job. Successful completion of the job as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_BOOLEAN.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_TIME_ELAPSED
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: time (ms) since the beginning of the job, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to timeElapsed field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_TIME_ELAPSED_NET
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: time (ms) since the beginning of the migration job NOT including the time required to transfer control flow from the source host to the destination host, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_TIME_REMAINING
macro.info: virDomainGetJobStats field: remaining time (ms) for VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_BOUNDED jobs, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. This field corresponds to timeRemaining field in virDomainJobInfo.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_LAUNCH_SECURITY_SEV_MEASUREMENT
macro.info: Macro represents the launch measurement of the SEV guest, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of virMemoryParameter. Provided for backwards compatibility; VIR_TYPED_PARAM_FIELD_LENGTH is the preferred value since 0.9.2.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_HARD_LIMIT
macro.info: Macro for the memory tunable hard_limit: it represents the maximum memory the guest can use, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_MIN_GUARANTEE
macro.info: Macro for the memory tunable min_guarantee: it represents the minimum memory guaranteed to be reserved for the guest, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_PARAM_UNLIMITED
macro.info: Macro providing the virMemoryParameter value that indicates "unlimited"

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_SOFT_LIMIT
macro.info: Macro for the memory tunable soft_limit: it represents the memory upper limit enforced during memory contention, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_SWAP_HARD_LIMIT
macro.info: Macro for the swap tunable swap_hard_limit: it represents the maximum swap plus memory the guest can use, as a ullong. This limit has to be more than VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_HARD_LIMIT.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_NUMA_MODE
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that lists the numa mode of a domain, as an int containing a virDomainNumatuneMemMode value.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_NUMA_NODESET
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that lists the numa nodeset of a domain, as a string.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_CAP
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum scheduler cap, when using the credit scheduler, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_CPU_SHARES
macro.info: Macro represents proportional weight of the scheduler used on the host cpu, when using the posix scheduler, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_EMULATOR_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota in microseconds, when using the posix scheduler, for all emulator activity not tied to vcpus, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_EMULATOR_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for all emulator activity not tied to vcpus, when using the posix scheduler, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_GLOBAL_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota, in microseconds, for whole domain, when using the posix scheduler, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_GLOBAL_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for whole domain, when using the posix scheduler, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_IOTHREAD_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota, in microseconds, for IOThreads only, when using the posix scheduler, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_IOTHREAD_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for IOThreads only, when using the posix scheduler, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_LIMIT
macro.info: Macro represents the scheduler limit value, when using the allocation scheduler, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_RESERVATION
macro.info: Macro represents the scheduler reservation value, when using the allocation scheduler, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_SHARES
macro.info: Macro represents the scheduler shares value, when using the allocation scheduler, as an int.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_VCPU_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota, in microseconds, for vcpus only, when using the posix scheduler, as a ullong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_VCPU_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for vcpus only, when using the posix scheduler, as an llong.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHEDULER_WEIGHT
macro.info: Macro represents the relative weight, when using the credit scheduler, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SCHED_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of virSchedParameter. Provided for backwards compatibility; VIR_TYPED_PARAM_FIELD_LENGTH is the preferred value since 0.9.2.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SEND_KEY_MAX_KEYS
macro.info: Maximum number of keycodes that can be sent in one virDomainSendKey() call.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_DISK
macro.info: Macro represents the name of guest disk for which the values are updated, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_GROUP_NAME
macro.info: Macro represents the group name to be used, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_READ_BYTES_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the read throughput limit in bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_READ_BYTES_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro represents the read throughput limit during bursts in maximum bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_READ_BYTES_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro represents the length in seconds allowed for a burst period for the blkdeviotune.read_bytes_sec_max as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_READ_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the read I/O operations per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_READ_IOPS_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro represents the read maximum I/O operations per second during bursts, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_READ_IOPS_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro represents the length in seconds allowed for a burst period for the blkdeviotune.read_iops_sec_max as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_SIZE_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the size maximum I/O operations per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_TOTAL_BYTES_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the total throughput limit in bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_TOTAL_BYTES_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro represents the total throughput limit during bursts in maximum bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_TOTAL_BYTES_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro represents the length in seconds allowed for a burst period for the blkdeviotune.total_bytes_sec_max, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_TOTAL_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the total I/O operations per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_TOTAL_IOPS_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro represents the total maximum I/O operations per second during bursts, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_TOTAL_IOPS_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro represents the length in seconds allowed for a burst period for the blkdeviotune.total_iops_sec_max as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_WRITE_BYTES_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the write throughput limit in bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_WRITE_BYTES_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro represents the write throughput limit during bursts in maximum bytes per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_WRITE_BYTES_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro represents the length in seconds allowed for a burst period for the blkdeviotune.write_bytes_sec_max as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_WRITE_IOPS_SEC
macro.info: Macro represents the write I/O operations per second, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_WRITE_IOPS_SEC_MAX
macro.info: Macro represents the write maximum I/O operations per second during bursts, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_BLKDEV_WRITE_IOPS_SEC_MAX_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro represents the length in seconds allowed for a burst period for the blkdeviotune.write_iops_sec_max as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_CPU_SHARES
macro.info: Macro represents proportional weight of the scheduler used on the host cpu, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_EMULATORPIN
macro.info: Macro represents formatted pinning for emulator process, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_EMULATOR_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota in microseconds, when using the posix scheduler, for all emulator activity not tied to vcpus, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_EMULATOR_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for all emulator activity not tied to vcpus, when using the posix scheduler, as an VIR_TYPED_PARAM_LLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_GLOBAL_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota, in microseconds, for whole domain, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_GLOBAL_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for whole domain, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_LLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_IOTHREADSPIN
macro.info: Macro represents formatted pinning for one IOThread specified by id which is appended to the parameter name, for example "cputune.iothreadpin1", as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_IOTHREAD_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota, in microseconds, for iothreads only, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_IOTHREAD_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for iothreads only, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_LLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_VCPUPIN
macro.info: Macro represents formatted pinning for one vcpu specified by id which is appended to the parameter name, for example "cputune.vcpupin1", as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_VCPU_PERIOD
macro.info: Macro represents the enforcement period for a quota, in microseconds, for vcpus only, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TUNABLE_CPU_VCPU_QUOTA
macro.info: Macro represents the maximum bandwidth to be used within a period for vcpus only, when using the posix scheduler, as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_LLONG.

macro.name: VIR_GET_CPUMAP
macro.info: This macro is to be used in conjunction with virDomainGetVcpus() and virDomainPinVcpu() APIs. VIR_GET_CPUMAP macro returns a pointer to the cpumap of the specified vcpu from cpumaps array.

arg.name: cpumaps
arg.info: pointer to an array of cpumap (in 8-bit bytes) (IN)

arg.name: maplen
arg.info: the length (in bytes) of one cpumap

macro.name: VIR_KEYCODE_SET_RFB
macro.info: Compatibility alias for VIR_KEYCODE_SET_QNUM, which replaced it since 4.2.0.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INCREMENT
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the increment added to VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INITIAL whenever the hypervisor decides the current rate is not enough to ensure convergence of the migration. As VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INITIAL
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the initial percentage guest CPUs are throttled to when auto-convergence decides migration is not converging. As VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_BANDWIDTH
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the maximum bandwidth (in MiB/s) that will be used for migration as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. If set to 0 or omitted, libvirt will choose a suitable default. Some hypervisors do not support this feature and will return an error if this field is used and is not 0.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_BANDWIDTH_POSTCOPY
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the maximum bandwidth (in MiB/s) that will be used for post-copy phase of a migration as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG. If set to 0 or omitted, post-copy migration speed will not be limited.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params multiple field: name of the method used to compress migration traffic. Supported compression methods: xbzrle, mt. The parameter may be specified multiple times if more than one method should be used.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_DTHREADS
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the number of decompression threads for multithread compression as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_LEVEL
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the level of compression for multithread compression as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT. Accepted values are in range 0-9. 0 is no compression, 1 is maximum speed and 9 is maximum compression.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_THREADS
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the number of compression threads for multithread compression as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_XBZRLE_CACHE
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the size of page cache for xbzrle compression as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_ULLONG.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DEST_NAME
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the name to be used for the domain on the destination host as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING. Omitting this parameter keeps the domain name the same. This field is only allowed to be used with hypervisors that support domain renaming during migration.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DEST_XML
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the new configuration to be used for the domain on the destination host as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING. The configuration must include an identical set of virtual devices, to ensure a stable guest ABI across migration. Only parameters related to host side configuration can be changed in the XML. Hypervisors which support this field will forbid migration if the provided XML would cause a change in the guest ABI. This field cannot be used to rename the domain during migration (use VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DEST_NAME field for that purpose). Domain name in the destination XML must match the original domain name. Omitting this parameter keeps the original domain configuration. Using this field with hypervisors that do not support changing domain configuration during migration will result in a failure.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DISKS_PORT
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: port that destination server should use for incoming disks migration. Type is VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT. If set to 0 or omitted, libvirt will choose a suitable default. At the moment this is only supported by the QEMU driver.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_GRAPHICS_URI
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: URI to use for migrating client's connection to domain's graphical console as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING. If specified, the client will be asked to automatically reconnect using these parameters instead of the automatically computed ones. This can be useful if, e.g., the client does not have a direct access to the network virtualization hosts are connected to and needs to connect through a proxy. The URI is formed as follows: protocol://hostname[:port]/[?parameters] where protocol is either "spice" or "vnc" and parameters is a list of protocol specific parameters separated by '&'. Currently recognized parameters are "tlsPort" and "tlsSubject". For example, spice://target.host.com:1234/?tlsPort=4567

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_LISTEN_ADDRESS
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: The listen address that hypervisor on the destination side should bind to for incoming migration. Both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are accepted as well as hostnames (the resolving is done on destination). Some hypervisors do not support this feature and will return an error if this field is used.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_MIGRATE_DISKS
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params multiple field: The multiple values that list the block devices to be migrated. At the moment this is only supported by the QEMU driver but not for the tunnelled migration.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_PARALLEL_CONNECTIONS
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: number of connections used during parallel migration. As VIR_TYPED_PARAM_INT.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_PERSIST_XML
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: the new persistent configuration to be used for the domain on the destination host as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING. This field cannot be used to rename the domain during migration (use VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DEST_NAME field for that purpose). Domain name in the destination XML must match the original domain name. Omitting this parameter keeps the original domain persistent configuration. Using this field with hypervisors that do not support changing domain configuration during migration will result in a failure.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_TLS_DESTINATION
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: override the destination host name used for TLS verification. As VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING. Normally the TLS certificate from the destination host must match the host's name for TLS verification to succeed. When the certificate does not match the destination hostname and the expected certificate's hostname is known, this parameter can be used to pass this expected hostname when starting the migration.

macro.name: VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_URI
macro.info: virDomainMigrate* params field: URI to use for initiating domain migration as VIR_TYPED_PARAM_STRING. It takes a hypervisor specific format. The uri_transports element of the hypervisor capabilities XML includes details of the supported URI schemes. When omitted libvirt will auto-generate suitable default URI. It is typically only necessary to specify this URI if the destination host has multiple interfaces and a specific interface is required to transmit migration data. This field may not be used when VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED flag is set.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_EVENT_CALLBACK
macro.info: Used to cast the event specific callback into the generic one for use for virConnectNetworkEventRegisterAny()

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_IN_AVERAGE
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound average of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_IN_BURST
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound burst of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_IN_FLOOR
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound floor of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_IN_PEAK
macro.info: Macro represents the inbound peak of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_OUT_AVERAGE
macro.info: Macro represents the outbound average of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_OUT_BURST
macro.info: Macro represents the outbound burst of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NETWORK_PORT_BANDWIDTH_OUT_PEAK
macro.info: Macro represents the outbound peak of NIC bandwidth, as a uint.

macro.name: VIR_NODEINFO_MAXCPUS
macro.info: This macro is to calculate the total number of CPUs supported but not necessary active in the host.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of virNodeCPUStats

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_IDLE
macro.info: The cumulative idle CPU time, since the node booting up (in nanoseconds).

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_INTR
macro.info: The cumulative interrupt CPU time, since the node booting up (in nanoseconds).

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_IOWAIT
macro.info: The cumulative I/O wait CPU time, since the node booting up (in nanoseconds).

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_KERNEL
macro.info: Macro for the cumulative CPU time which was spent by the kernel, since the node booting up (in nanoseconds).

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_USER
macro.info: The cumulative CPU time which was spent by user processes, since the node booting up (in nanoseconds).

macro.name: VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_UTILIZATION
macro.info: The CPU utilization of a node. The usage value is in percent and 100% represents all CPUs of the node.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_DEVICE_EVENT_CALLBACK
macro.info: Used to cast the event specific callback into the generic one for use for virConnectNodeDeviceEventRegisterAny()

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_FULL_SCANS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many times all mergeable areas have been scanned.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_MERGE_ACROSS_NODES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents whether pages from different NUMA nodes can be merged. The parameter has type int, when its value is 0, only pages which physically reside in the memory area of same NUMA node are merged; When its value is 1, pages from all nodes can be merged. Other values are reserved for future use.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_PAGES_SHARED
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many the shared memory pages are being used.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_PAGES_SHARING
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many sites are sharing the pages i.e. how much saved.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_PAGES_TO_SCAN
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many present pages to scan before the shared memory service goes to sleep.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_PAGES_UNSHARED
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many pages unique but repeatedly checked for merging.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_PAGES_VOLATILE
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many pages changing too fast to be placed in a tree.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_SHARED_SLEEP_MILLISECS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter that represents how many milliseconds the shared memory service should sleep before next scan.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_BUFFERS
macro.info: Macro for the buffer memory: On Linux, it is only returned in case of VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_ALL_CELLS.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_CACHED
macro.info: Macro for the cached memory: On Linux, it is only returned in case of VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_ALL_CELLS.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of virNodeMemoryStats

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_FREE
macro.info: Macro for the free memory of specified cell: On Linux, it includes buffer and cached memory, in case of VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_ALL_CELLS.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_TOTAL
macro.info: Macro for the total memory of specified cell: it represents the maximum memory.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_SEV_CBITPOS
macro.info: Macro represents the CBit Position used by hypervisor when SEV is enabled.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_SEV_CERT_CHAIN
macro.info: Macro represents the platform certificate chain that includes the platform endorsement key (PEK), owner certificate authority (OCD) and chip endorsement key (CEK), as VIR_TYPED_PARAMS_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_SEV_PDH
macro.info: Macro represents the Platform Diffie-Hellman key, as VIR_TYPED_PARAMS_STRING.

macro.name: VIR_NODE_SEV_REDUCED_PHYS_BITS
macro.info: Macro represents the number of bits we lose in physical address space when SEV is enabled in the guest.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_ALIGNMENT_FAULTS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents alignment_faults perf event which can be used to measure the count of alignment faults by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.alignment_faults" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_BRANCH_INSTRUCTIONS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents branch_instructions perf event which can be used to measure the count of branch instructions by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.branch_instructions" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_BRANCH_MISSES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents branch_misses perf event which can be used to measure the count of branch misses by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.branch_misses" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_BUS_CYCLES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents bus_cycles perf event which can be used to measure the count of bus cycles by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.bus_cycles" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CACHE_MISSES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents cache_misses perf event which can be used to measure the count of cache misses by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.cache_misses" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CACHE_REFERENCES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents cache_references perf event which can be used to measure the count of cache hits by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.cache_references" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CMT
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents CMT perf event which can be used to measure the usage of cache (bytes) by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.cmt" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CONTEXT_SWITCHES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents context_switches perf event which can be used to measure the count of context switches by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.context_switches" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CPU_CLOCK
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents cpu_clock perf event which can be used to measure the count of cpu clock time by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.cpu_clock" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CPU_CYCLES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents cpu_cycles perf event describing the total/elapsed cpu cycles. This can be used to measure how many cpu cycles one instruction needs. It corresponds to the "perf.cpu_cycles" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_CPU_MIGRATIONS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents cpu_migrations perf event which can be used to measure the count of cpu migrations by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.cpu_migrations" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_EMULATION_FAULTS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents emulation_faults perf event which can be used to measure the count of emulation faults by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.emulation_faults" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_INSTRUCTIONS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents instructions perf event which can be used to measure the count of instructions by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.instructions" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_MBML
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents MBML perf event which can be used to monitor the amount of data (bytes/s) sent through the memory controller on the socket. It corresponds to the "perf.mbml" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_MBMT
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents MBMT perf event which can be used to monitor total system bandwidth (bytes/s) from one level of cache to another. It corresponds to the "perf.mbmt" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_PAGE_FAULTS
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents page_faults perf event which can be used to measure the count of page faults by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.page_faults" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_PAGE_FAULTS_MAJ
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents page_faults_maj perf event which can be used to measure the count of major page faults by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.page_faults_maj" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_PAGE_FAULTS_MIN
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents page_faults_min perf event which can be used to measure the count of minor page faults by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.page_faults_min" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_REF_CPU_CYCLES
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents ref_cpu_cycles perf event which can be used to measure the count of total cpu cycles not affected by CPU frequency scaling by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.ref_cpu_cycles" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_STALLED_CYCLES_BACKEND
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents stalled_cycles_backend perf event which can be used to measure the count of stalled cpu cycles in the backend of the instruction processor pipeline by application running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.stalled_cycles_backend" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_STALLED_CYCLES_FRONTEND
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents stalled_cycles_frontend perf event which can be used to measure the count of stalled cpu cycles in the frontend of the instruction processor pipeline by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.stalled_cycles_frontend" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_PERF_PARAM_TASK_CLOCK
macro.info: Macro for typed parameter name that represents task_clock perf event which can be used to measure the count of task clock time by applications running on the platform. It corresponds to the "perf.task_clock" field in the *Stats APIs.

macro.name: VIR_SECRET_EVENT_CALLBACK
macro.info: Used to cast the event specific callback into the generic one for use for virConnectSecretEventRegisterAny()

macro.name: VIR_SECURITY_DOI_BUFLEN
macro.info: Macro providing the maximum length of the virSecurityModel doi string.

macro.name: VIR_SECURITY_LABEL_BUFLEN
macro.info: Macro providing the maximum length of the virSecurityLabel label string. Note that this value is based on that used by Labeled NFS.

macro.name: VIR_SECURITY_MODEL_BUFLEN
macro.info: Macro providing the maximum length of the virSecurityModel model string.

macro.name: VIR_STORAGE_POOL_EVENT_CALLBACK
macro.info: Used to cast the event specific callback into the generic one for use for virConnectStoragePoolEventRegisterAny()

macro.name: VIR_TYPED_PARAM_FIELD_LENGTH
macro.info: Macro providing the field length of virTypedParameter name

macro.name: VIR_UNUSE_CPU
macro.info: This macro is to be used in conjunction with virDomainPinVcpu() API. It resets the bit (CPU not usable) of the related cpu in cpumap.

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN/OUT)

macro.name: VIR_USE_CPU
macro.info: This macro is to be used in conjunction with virDomainPinVcpu() API. It sets the bit (CPU usable) of the related cpu in cpumap.

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN/OUT)

macro.name: VIR_UUID_BUFLEN
macro.info: This macro provides the length of the buffer required for virDomainGetUUID()

macro.name: VIR_UUID_STRING_BUFLEN
macro.info: This macro provides the length of the buffer required for virDomainGetUUIDString()

enum.name: VIR_CONNECT_DOMAIN_EVENT_AGENT_LIFECYCLE_REASON_DOMAIN_STARTED
enum.info: state changed due to domain start

enum.name: VIR_CONNECT_GET_ALL_DOMAINS_STATS_BACKING
enum.info: include backing chain for block stats

enum.name: VIR_CONNECT_GET_ALL_DOMAINS_STATS_NOWAIT
enum.info: report statistics that can be obtained immediately without any blocking

enum.name: VIR_CONNECT_LIST_SECRETS_EPHEMERAL
enum.info: kept in memory, never stored persistently

enum.name: VIR_CONNECT_LIST_SECRETS_PRIVATE
enum.info: not revealed to any caller of libvirt, nor to any other node

enum.name: VIR_CONNECT_NO_ALIASES
enum.info: Don't try to resolve URI aliases

enum.name: VIR_CRED_LAST
enum.info: More may be added - expect the unexpected

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_CONFIG
enum.info: Affect persistent domain state. 1 << 2 is reserved for virTypedParameterFlags

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCKED
enum.info: the domain is blocked on resource

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COMMIT_ACTIVE
enum.info: Allow a two-phase commit when top is the active layer

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COMMIT_BANDWIDTH_BYTES
enum.info: bandwidth in bytes/s instead of MiB/s

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COMMIT_DELETE
enum.info: Delete any files that are now invalid after their contents have been committed

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COMMIT_RELATIVE
enum.info: keep the backing chain referenced using relative names

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COMMIT_SHALLOW
enum.info: NULL base means next backing file, not whole chain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COPY_REUSE_EXT
enum.info: Reuse existing external file for a copy

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COPY_SHALLOW
enum.info: Limit copy to top of source backing chain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_COPY_TRANSIENT_JOB
enum.info: Don't force usage of recoverable job for the copy operation

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_INFO_BANDWIDTH_BYTES
enum.info: bandwidth in bytes/s instead of MiB/s

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_SPEED_BANDWIDTH_BYTES
enum.info: bandwidth in bytes/s instead of MiB/s

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_TYPE_ACTIVE_COMMIT
enum.info: Active Block Commit (virDomainBlockCommit with flags), job exists as long as sync is active

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_TYPE_COMMIT
enum.info: Block Commit (virDomainBlockCommit without flags), job ends on completion

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_TYPE_COPY
enum.info: Block Copy (virDomainBlockCopy, or virDomainBlockRebase with flags), job exists as long as mirroring is active

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_JOB_TYPE_PULL
enum.info: Block Pull (virDomainBlockPull, or virDomainBlockRebase without flags), job ends on completion

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_PULL_BANDWIDTH_BYTES
enum.info: bandwidth in bytes/s instead of MiB/s

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_BANDWIDTH_BYTES
enum.info: bandwidth in bytes/s instead of MiB/s

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_COPY_DEV
enum.info: Treat destination as block device instead of file

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_RELATIVE
enum.info: Keep backing chain referenced using relative names

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_REUSE_EXT
enum.info: Reuse existing external file for a copy

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_SHALLOW
enum.info: Limit copy to top of source backing chain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_RESIZE_BYTES
enum.info: size in bytes instead of KiB

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHANNEL_FORCE
enum.info: abort a (possibly) active channel connection to force a new connection

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHECKPOINT_CREATE_QUIESCE
enum.info: use guest agent to quiesce all mounted file systems within the domain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHECKPOINT_LIST_DESCENDANTS
enum.info: List all descendants, not just children, when listing a checkpoint

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHECKPOINT_LIST_LEAVES
enum.info: Filter by checkpoints with no children

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHECKPOINT_LIST_NO_LEAVES
enum.info: Filter by checkpoints that have children

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHECKPOINT_LIST_ROOTS
enum.info: Filter by checkpoints with no parents, when listing a domain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CHECKPOINT_LIST_TOPOLOGICAL
enum.info: Ensure parents occur before children in the resulting list

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CONSOLE_FORCE
enum.info: abort a (possibly) active console connection to force a new connection

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CONSOLE_SAFE
enum.info: check if the console driver supports safe console operations

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CONTROL_ERROR
enum.info: unusable, domain cannot be fully operated, possible reason is provided in the details field

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CONTROL_ERROR_REASON_INTERNAL
enum.info: error caused due to internal failure in libvirt

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CONTROL_JOB
enum.info: background job is running (can be monitored by virDomainGetJobInfo); only limited set of commands may be allowed

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CORE_DUMP_FORMAT_LAST
enum.info: NB: this enum value will increase over time as new events are added to the libvirt API. It reflects the last state supported by this version of the libvirt API.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_CORE_DUMP_FORMAT_RAW
enum.info: dump guest memory in raw format

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_DEFINE_VALIDATE
enum.info: Validate the XML document against schema

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_DESTROY_DEFAULT
enum.info: Default behavior - could lead to data loss!!

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_DEVICE_MODIFY_FORCE
enum.info: Additionally, these flags may be bitwise-OR'd in.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_DISK_ERROR_NO_SPACE
enum.info: no space left on the device

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_DEFINED_FROM_SNAPSHOT
enum.info: Config was restored from a snapshot

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_DISK_CHANGE_MISSING_ON_START
enum.info: Removable media changed to empty according to startup policy as source was missing. oldSrcPath is set, newSrcPath is NULL

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_DISK_DROP_MISSING_ON_START
enum.info: Disk was dropped from domain as source file was missing. oldSrcPath is set, newSrcPath is NULL

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_LAST
enum.info: NB: this enum value will increase over time as new events are added to the libvirt API. It reflects the last event ID supported by this version of the libvirt API.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_IO_ERROR_REPORT
enum.info: IO error reported to guest OS

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_PMSUSPENDED_DISK
enum.info: Guest was PM suspended to disk

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_PMSUSPENDED_MEMORY
enum.info: Guest was PM suspended to memory

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_POSTCOPY
enum.info: Resumed, but migration is still running in post-copy mode

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_RESUMED_UNPAUSED
enum.info: Normal resume due to admin unpause

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SHUTDOWN_GUEST
enum.info: Domain finished shutting down after request from the guest itself (e.g. hardware-specific action)

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SHUTDOWN_HOST
enum.info: Domain finished shutting down after request from the host (e.g. killed by a signal)

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_API_ERROR
enum.info: suspended after failure during libvirt API call

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_IOERROR
enum.info: Suspended due to a disk I/O error

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_PAUSED
enum.info: Normal suspend due to admin pause

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_WATCHDOG
enum.info: Suspended due to a watchdog firing

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_WATCHDOG_DEBUG
enum.info: No action, a debug message logged

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_WATCHDOG_INJECTNMI
enum.info: Inject a non-maskable interrupt into guest

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_WATCHDOG_SHUTDOWN
enum.info: Guest is requested to gracefully shutdown

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_BOUNDED
enum.info: Job with a finite completion time

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_CANCELLED
enum.info: Job was aborted, but isn't cleaned up

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_COMPLETED
enum.info: Job has finished, but isn't cleaned up

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_FAILED
enum.info: Job hit error, but isn't cleaned up

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_STATS_COMPLETED
enum.info: return stats of a recently completed job

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_STATS_KEEP_COMPLETED
enum.info: don't remove completed stats when reading them

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_UNBOUNDED
enum.info: Job without a finite completion time

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_LAST
enum.info: NB: this enum value will increase over time as new events are added to the libvirt API. It reflects the last state supported by this version of the libvirt API.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_AVAILABLE
enum.info: The total amount of usable memory as seen by the domain. This value may be less than the amount of memory assigned to the domain if a balloon driver is in use or if the guest OS does not initialize all assigned pages. This value is expressed in kB.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_DISK_CACHES
enum.info: The amount of memory, that can be quickly reclaimed without additional I/O (in kB). Typically these pages are used for caching files from disk.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_HUGETLB_PGALLOC
enum.info: The amount of successful huge page allocations from inside the domain via virtio balloon.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_HUGETLB_PGFAIL
enum.info: The amount of failed huge page allocations from inside the domain via virtio balloon.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_LAST_UPDATE
enum.info: Timestamp of the last update of statistics, in seconds.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_MAJOR_FAULT
enum.info: Page faults occur when a process makes a valid access to virtual memory that is not available. When servicing the page fault, if disk IO is required, it is considered a major fault. If not, it is a minor fault. These are expressed as the number of faults that have occurred.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_NR
enum.info: The number of statistics supported by this version of the interface. To add new statistics, add them to the enum and increase this value.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_RSS
enum.info: Resident Set Size of the process running the domain. This value is in kB

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_SWAP_IN
enum.info: The total amount of data read from swap space (in kB).

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_SWAP_OUT
enum.info: The total amount of memory written out to swap space (in kB).

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_UNUSED
enum.info: The amount of memory left completely unused by the system. Memory that is available but used for reclaimable caches should NOT be reported as free. This value is expressed in kB.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEMORY_STAT_USABLE
enum.info: How much the balloon can be inflated without pushing the guest system to swap, corresponds to 'Available' in /proc/meminfo

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MEM_MAXIMUM
enum.info: Additionally, these flags may be bitwise-OR'd in.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_MIGRATE_MAX_SPEED_POSTCOPY
enum.info: Set or get maximum speed of post-copy migration.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_NUMATUNE_MEM_LAST
enum.info: This constant is subject to change

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PAUSED
enum.info: the domain is paused by user

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PAUSED_CRASHED
enum.info: paused due to a guest crash

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PAUSED_IOERROR
enum.info: paused due to a disk I/O error

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PAUSED_WATCHDOG
enum.info: paused due to a watchdog event

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PMSUSPENDED
enum.info: the domain is suspended by guest power management

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PROCESS_SIGNAL_POLL
enum.info: SIGPOLL (also known as SIGIO on Linux)

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_PROCESS_SIGNAL_SYS
enum.info: SIGSYS (also known as SIGUNUSED on Linux)

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_RUNNING_WAKEUP
enum.info: returned from pmsuspended due to wakeup event

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SHUTDOWN
enum.info: the domain is being shut down

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SHUTOFF_DAEMON
enum.info: daemon decides to kill domain during reconnection processing

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SHUTOFF_FROM_SNAPSHOT
enum.info: restored from a snapshot which was taken while domain was shutoff

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_CREATE_LIVE
enum.info: create the snapshot while the guest is running

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_CREATE_QUIESCE
enum.info: use guest agent to quiesce all mounted file systems within the domain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_CREATE_VALIDATE
enum.info: validate the XML against the schema

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_ACTIVE
enum.info: Filter by snapshots taken while guest was active, and with memory state

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_DESCENDANTS
enum.info: List all descendants, not just children, when listing a snapshot For historical reasons, groups do not use contiguous bits.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_DISK_ONLY
enum.info: Filter by snapshots taken while guest was active, but without memory state

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_EXTERNAL
enum.info: Filter by snapshots that use files external to disk images

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_INACTIVE
enum.info: Filter by snapshots taken while guest was shut off

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_INTERNAL
enum.info: Filter by snapshots stored internal to disk images

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_LEAVES
enum.info: Filter by snapshots with no children

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_METADATA
enum.info: Filter by snapshots which have metadata

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_NO_LEAVES
enum.info: Filter by snapshots that have children

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_NO_METADATA
enum.info: Filter by snapshots with no metadata

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_ROOTS
enum.info: Filter by snapshots with no parents, when listing a domain

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_SNAPSHOT_LIST_TOPOLOGICAL
enum.info: Ensure parents occur before children in the resulting list

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_START_AUTODESTROY
enum.info: Automatically kill guest when virConnectPtr is closed

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_START_VALIDATE
enum.info: Validate the XML document against schema

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_TIME_SYNC
enum.info: Re-sync domain time from domain's RTC

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_CHECKPOINTS_METADATA
enum.info: If last use of domain, then also remove any checkpoint metadata Future undefine control flags should come here.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_SNAPSHOTS_METADATA
enum.info: If last use of domain, then also remove any snapshot metadata

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_VCPU_HOTPLUGGABLE
enum.info: Modify state of the cpu in the guest

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_VCPU_MAXIMUM
enum.info: Additionally, these flags may be bitwise-OR'd in.

enum.name: VIR_DOMAIN_XML_UPDATE_CPU
enum.info: update guest CPU requirements according to host CPU

enum.name: VIR_ERR_ACCESS_DENIED
enum.info: operation on the object/resource was denied

enum.name: VIR_ERR_AGENT_UNRESPONSIVE
enum.info: guest agent is unresponsive, not running or not usable

enum.name: VIR_ERR_AGENT_UNSYNCED
enum.info: guest agent replies with wrong id to guest-sync command (DEPRECATED)

enum.name: VIR_ERR_ARGUMENT_UNSUPPORTED
enum.info: valid API use but unsupported by the given driver

enum.name: VIR_ERR_BLOCK_COPY_ACTIVE
enum.info: action prevented by block copy job

enum.name: VIR_ERR_CONF_SYNTAX
enum.info: failed to parse the syntax of a conf file

enum.name: VIR_ERR_CPU_INCOMPATIBLE

enum.name: VIR_ERR_DEVICE_MISSING
enum.info: fail to find the desired device

enum.name: VIR_ERR_GET_FAILED
enum.info: a HTTP GET command to failed

enum.name: VIR_ERR_MIGRATE_FINISH_OK
enum.info: Finish API succeeded but it is expected to return NULL

enum.name: VIR_ERR_MIGRATE_PERSIST_FAILED
enum.info: a migration worked, but making the VM persist on the dest host failed

enum.name: VIR_ERR_MULTIPLE_INTERFACES
enum.info: more than one matching interface found

enum.name: VIR_ERR_NO_DOMAIN
enum.info: domain not found or unexpectedly disappeared

enum.name: VIR_ERR_NO_DOMAIN_BACKUP
enum.info: domain backup job id not found

enum.name: VIR_ERR_NO_XEN
enum.info: could not open Xen hypervisor control

enum.name: VIR_ERR_NO_XENSTORE
enum.info: could not open Xen Store control

enum.name: VIR_ERR_OPEN_FAILED
enum.info: failed to open a conf file

enum.name: VIR_ERR_OPERATION_ABORTED

enum.name: VIR_ERR_OPERATION_INVALID
enum.info: operation is not applicable at this time

enum.name: VIR_ERR_OPERATION_UNSUPPORTED
enum.info: The requested operation is not supported

enum.name: VIR_ERR_PARSE_FAILED
enum.info: failed to parse a conf file

enum.name: VIR_ERR_POST_FAILED
enum.info: a HTTP POST command to failed

enum.name: VIR_ERR_READ_FAILED
